name: NPR
text:
In Montgomery, Ohio, the annual Fourth of July parade is a long honored tradition.

To keep it up during the pandemic, they've decided to do a "reverse parade" this year — where the units are stationery and the spectators drive through.
https://t.co/I9Acpwlpk3

name: NPR
text:
Photographer Salgu Wissmath says gender dysphoria is "sorely misunderstood by society."

Using deeply intimate portraits, they set out to document some of the experiences of trans and nonbinary people — through a queer lens.
https://t.co/HvkaRauRLJ

name: NPR
text:
Vice President Pence wore a face mask to a public briefing on Tuesday. The message from the surgeon general and others was clear: Americans should wear masks to prevent the spread of COVID-19.
https://t.co/RE7Zju8lUu

name: NPR
text:
"There are so many people who believe that this is not reality, that what you're hearing is made up or false, and I want to take them all and walk them through an ICU to see a husband and wife lying side by side intubated ... and say, "It is very real."
https://t.co/NCdhWuQgY0

name: NPR
text:
Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on Monday endorsed wearing face masks as part of a "new middle ground" between a return to normal life and strict coronavirus restrictions.
https://t.co/ZEclO3lizt

name: NPR
text:
Martin Gugino, the 75-year-old protester who was shoved by riot police in Buffalo, N.Y., earlier this month, causing him to fall backward and fracture his skull, has been released from the hospital after nearly 4 weeks.
https://t.co/rVWYrhTPRh
